context:
The Centre for Business of the college has a Strategic Plan for the three-year period 2021-24 with the key goal of creating a first-rate teaching and learning experience for students. The plan focuses on leveraging the strengths of the college, developing human resource capacity, and repositioning the Centre for Business (CfB) with a competitive advantage.

The implementation of the plan is expressed through annual Business Plans. The CfB aims to be recognized as a leader in applied business education, embracing values of People, Pedagogy, and Progressiveness. In terms of People, the CfB builds communities of practice using equity, diversity, and inclusion as a guide. For Pedagogy, differentiated learning experiences are delivered for students' real-world competencies development, including interdisciplinary problem-solving, experiential learning, digital thinking, and analytical skills. The focus on Progressiveness includes maintaining a relentless focus on student experience and innovation to maximize learning outcomes.

The CfB has four major business plan elements: delivering learning experiences for future and global skills, academic planning which involves building interconnected partnerships with other post-secondary institutions, industry, and community, creating a resilient CfB community that is adaptable, entrepreneurial, and diverse, and strengthening pedagogical expertise, delivery capacity, and capabilities.

Graduates of the Centre for Business are workplace-ready business professionals. The values of People, Pedagogy, and Progressiveness in the CfB are embraced to prepare workplace-ready business professionals.
